Day 6 Deadline: (expired on 2013-03-29 07:00:07)

Assuming you don’t know these already even though they’re practically the same as every other rule set on this site, please read the following rules. They have been redesigned from various sources which you probably can’t recognise nor will be do anything about.


1. Sitewide rules and guidelines apply.
2. Do not quote or link to anything anybody reading the thread cannot freely access. This includes all private communication with the mod and quicktopics.
3. Discussion about this game is only allowed to happen within this thread unless especially told otherwise via your role pm.
4. Do not use excessive formatting in your posts; this includes tags and other items which will affect readability of the game. Spoiler= tags are allowed however plain Spoiler tags are not.
5. Once revealed as dead, you are not allowed to post in thread, this includes any “Bah!” posts, until endgame where I have declared the winner.
6. Prods will be issued to those not posting in the thread for 72 hours, without declaring V/LA either bolded in thread, via pm to the mod or using V/LA tags.
a. If you fail to respond to a prod within 24 hours after it was sent out, you will be replaced.
b. If you are prodded twice within a day phase, all your future prods will occur at 48 hours without a post.
c. If you require a fourth or higher prod at any stage of the game, you will only have 12 hours to post before I start seeking a replacement.
7. If I have posted that a replacement is being looked for to replace, and you have arrived late after a prod or changed your mind after requesting replacement, you will be required to follow it through as per any other possible replacement. I will not hold the spot open for you if I do get an offer.
8. You may either use
VOTE: tags or
vote: bold to vote during the day.
a. Unvotes are appreciated however they are not required.
b. To lynch someone you will require more than 50.1% of the votes available.
c. If there is no one above that level of votes at deadline a no lynch will occur.
9. Day phases will last a maximum of two weeks, night phases will last a minimum of sixty hours.
Any rule offences will be dealt with depending on the level of offence at my discretion.

Also have fun and remember this is a game, personal attacks will not be tolerated.

Welcome to Mini 1407,

You are a Vanilla Townie

Your only actions are you vote during the day.
You win with the town when all threats to the town are dead, and at least one member of your faction is still alive.
Please confirm you have understood your role via return pm.

Game thread is located here


Spoiler: Changed/Updated Rules
6b. If you are prodded twice within a day phase, your prod respond before replacement will be reduced to 12 hours.
6c. A third prod at any stage will mean you will be prodded at 48 hours without a post.

Role PMs have been sent out, game will start with the earlier of everyone confirming or 48 hours from now.

Hello to the many of you that I know! Rob, Imlosion, chkflip, and Peregrine. Oh and Mod, of course.

I've got a pretty busy schedule over the next week and few days, but I will still be posting.

If anyone who is in a timezone outside of standard US ones could be so helpful, as well as any players who are brand new and aren't familiar with the basics of mafiascum play, let me know.

No RVS from me today. I'll check out and see what you guys do.

Vote ion

How dare you make me remember Chemistry!

P-edit: Why no RVS from you, ICE?
Also, ICE, would you be so kind as to update your Wiki somewhat so that I can look into your meta?
Or alternatively, just provide your last five town games and last five scum games (if enough exist to do so).

I usually don't like to RVS. I have in a few recent games, just for fun, but it really serves me no purpose. Believe me, you'll get action out of me early enough. You'll notice plenty of that in my meta.

I honestly don't know how to update my wiki, as a friend put that together for me.

My sig should show that I've only played 3 scum games: one well played gambit and two miserable failures. This is the only one that wasn't lost due to crash, or so I believe because I can't find the other.

My recent town games are pretty easy to find. The two I just played in shouldn't need to be asked for. Here are a few more. I'm on kind of a hot streak lately, with only a single loss in my last 5 town games.
Meta shows Ice doesn't RVS as town or scum very often, so null tell.
Hello, iceninja.
I've actually stopped rvsing (to an extent) too. It's more interesting, in a way, to see people's responses to a lack of RVS than it is to see responses to RVS votes.

It's hard to explain because it's mostly gut, but here goes:

The bolded is a big part of my impression of this post. I hate it when people explicitly call themselves town. It sounds incredibly fake to me. Everyone is trying to claim they're town in this game - what's the point of coming out and saying it? In your post, you qualify the "we" with "as a town." This is unnecessary, so it gives me the impression that you want to ensure that you're associating yourself with the town. It reads like that is your primary objective, not reaction baiting.

Combine that with the fact that this type of post is anti-town and useless from the get-go, and I don't come away with a good read on you.

Spoiler: Theory rant (directed at ICE)
I've always hated the reasoning "this fight is not TvT." It isn't scummy per se, but I don't think that it is logically possible to justify the position that a fight between two players is not TvT without explicitly scumreading one or both players. Not to say that ICE hasn't - but think about it this way. The fight between matt and chk consists of two sets of interactions - matt's actions towards chk, and chk's towards matt. If matt is town, then his interactions towards chk are going to be the same whether chk is town or scum - thus, it is impossible to distinguish between mattTown-chkTown and mattTown-chkScum based only on their interactions. Likewise, it is impossible to distinguish between mattTown-chkTown and mattScum-chkTown. Ergo, the only situation that can be distinguished from TvT solely based on their interactions is SvS - that is to say that their interactions as a whole cannot be used as a tell that would rule out TvT. It would be a legitimate argument to say "matt's actions towards chkflip look like scum -> town to me" or "chk's actions towards matt look like scum -> town to me", but to say "this fight doesn't look like TvT to me" without specifying how exactly it isn't TvT is just bullshit. Townies do it, which is sad, but it's a stupid argument - it's one of those things which is usually based entirely on gut without anything to back it up logically. Gut is fine, but it has to have some (at least vague or tenuous) basis in logic.

Alright, managed to go through this whole thing. I've got a decent number of townreads but a lot of nulls and few scumreads here, I think mostly a by-product of the fact that a decent number of people need to check back in and post some more content. Here's where I stand on every player in the game so far, if you need clarification or elaboration on anything, please let me know.

TOWN (Strongest to Weakest):

implosion: Not really sure where the suspicion of him is coming from, I'm feeling pretty good about implosion being town. First few pages were pretty underwhelming for him, but his vote on chkflip in #69 backed up with the points of reasoning regarding his voting patterns and the follow-up pressure in #89 make a lot of sense and fit very much what I know of his town forum meta - push whatever he can to get the game going, even if it's just something he finds a little bit suspicious. His follow-up on Rob re: him asking ICE for non-RVS meta but not others is a great question, one that I had myself (see below). His switch away from chkflip and onto denis for strategically lurking, complete with the meta links and examination of the frequency of his posting is something that I think is very much unlikely to come from implosion as scum. In both games I specced with scum implosion, he either lurks hardcore (Mafia Behind the Maiden) or mainly just uses lazy/bullshit reasoning (Otherworld) and I'm not saying either of those flavors of implosion here. I also think implosion comes across as very genuine in the entire back-and-forth with Junpei, especially re: pushing lurkers due to PoE reasons and not out of opportunism.

projectmatt: Another player I don't really understand people suspecting as I think projectmatt's reactions are very town and I think he is playing massively to his town meta. His entrance into the game pushing a joke wagon on Denis in #16-#20 hits pretty much what I expected him to come in doing, I think he'd have been a lot more stiff and scripted as scum. The sarcastic reaction to ICEninja's vote, townreading him, and silent vote on Bub in #38 because he found Bub's entrance to be awkward (#67) and slightly scummy fits how I know he scumhunts to a tee. While I don't exactly agree that Bub is scummy at all (again, see below), there's an identifiable thought process with the vote that very much reads like a legitimate attempt to scumhunt. I also liked the way he held his ground in defending himself against ICEninja, particularly in #65, as I think he'd have caved or retreated in some form as scum. I don't find the confidence in his townread on chkflip at all scummy given chkflip's reactions and it makes sense that they remind him of other games together. Also like his reads list in #197 but that's a pretty minor thing.

chkflip: The argument with projectmatt about matt's ability to read him as town was literally one of the dumbest fucking things I have ever read in a game of mafia. That being said, I'm 100% with implosion that he comes across like he's genuinely frustrated. The initial accusation that projectmatt couldn't possibly be able to townread him because he's almost always perceived as scummy in #83 is completely genuine and would be a frankly bizarre angle of attack for him to take as scum. And while his #99 is really strained the fact that he goes through the effort of plowing through the games linked comes across like a legitimate attempt to test projectmatt's general ability to read him and I like him asking Bub to chime in on their interaction (#102). Do want to say, though, projectmatt being hypothetically wrong about his ability to read you doesn't necessarily mean he's lying, he could just be mistaken.

Bub Bidderskins: I actually found his vote on Ion in #13 with the serious reasoning attached to be somewhat of a towntell as it reminds me of his early voting in Mini 1394 as town. Also liked his jump to voting projectmatt in #45 and his interpretation of matt's chkflip vote in #101, while I don't agree with the conclusion there's a thought process going on here that I find natural. His analysis of the projectmatt/chkflip interaction in #131 and #182 makes sense though I think it's a little naive (for example, it's certainly within the realm of possibility that a hypothetical projectmatt/chkflip scum duo would distance in this fashion given the overblown nature of their back and forth but I'm finding it unlikely given that I'm townreading both of them individually).

Rob13: Wasn't a big fan of his early posting initially regarding meta-checking ICE's RVS meta for a couple of reasons: 1) it felt like a super minor thing to ask about, and 2) he doesn't follow up on it with other players (specifically implosion, who deliberately refused to partake in RVS) and his line of inquiry regarding projectmatt's early joke posting seemed lame. However, I do agree that there seems to be a genuine conviction behind his scumhunting and I particularly liked the way he analyzed the projectmatt/chkflip interaction as scum on scum in #144 as I think it makes sense that he would find their interaction forced. Aside from that, nothing really caught my eye and I get the impression overall that Rob13's a newbie playing very rigidly not really scummy.

Lincolm: Weakest townread here mostly due to the effort and level of depth he put into his reads list in #196, which seems impressive to me with a player of his experience. However, I do want to ask one thing because it's really bugging me about him and I'm bolding it because it really needs answering: What made you change your mind on Denis from saying you were sure he was pro-town (#178) to having him as a scumread (#196)?

NULL:

denisatp: I don't find his early trolling, abrasive attitude, and early tracker claim to be particularly scummy and knowing him I think that's something that would come from Denis as either alignment really. I do want to see more of him and what he actually thinks, though.

wam: Nothing much here. I guess his voting chkflip for being a late bandwagon voter in #32 and #34 makes sense but I don't think it's alignment indicative even for someone with his experience level.

Junpei: Given my own assumption about his skill and his experience level, I think his entire back and forth with implosion and his scumreads on Denis/projectmatt is something he could plausibly do as both alignments. The points projectmatt brings up in #197 make sense, but I need to see some more from him to be able to actually gauge his alignment here.

PeregrineV: Having played with him once in the past (albeit in a hydra) and having followed some of his games, Pere can be tough to read since he tends to be pretty lurky/low content as both alignments. That being said, I don't like how he interprets the projectmatt/chkflip interaction in #139 by implying they could both be town ("the exchange could be legit") and then suggests that they could both be scum ("if you step back and look at the topics of each post and paraphrase each one, sounds kind of fake"). You guys are dumb.

A watcher doesn't get a result on denis, it gets a result on people who targeted denis. Denis' action occurring or not has 0 relation to the watcher result.

To put it simply:

Watcher targets person A
Person A does whatever
Person B roleblocks person A
Watcher sees person B visit person A
This is ok. All good.

Watcher targets person C
Person A actions on person C
Person C roleblocks person A
Watcher gets no result
This is where roleblocking relates to watchers.

Watchers get a result of who visits their target, their target's action has no relation to this outside of natural relations such as being untargetable / roleblocking the watcher / etc

Spoiler: Theory rant (directed at ICE)
I've always hated the reasoning "this fight is not TvT." It isn't scummy per se, but I don't think that it is logically possible to justify the position that a fight between two players is not TvT without explicitly scumreading one or both players. Not to say that ICE hasn't - but think about it this way. The fight between matt and chk consists of two sets of interactions - matt's actions towards chk, and chk's towards matt. If matt is town, then his interactions towards chk are going to be the same whether chk is town or scum - thus, it is impossible to distinguish between mattTown-chkTown and mattTown-chkScum based only on their interactions. Likewise, it is impossible to distinguish between mattTown-chkTown and mattScum-chkTown. Ergo, the only situation that can be distinguished from TvT solely based on their interactions is SvS - that is to say that their interactions as a whole cannot be used as a tell that would rule out TvT. It would be a legitimate argument to say "matt's actions towards chkflip look like scum -> town to me" or "chk's actions towards matt look like scum -> town to me", but to say "this fight doesn't look like TvT to me" without specifying how exactly it isn't TvT is just bullshit. Townies do it, which is sad, but it's a stupid argument - it's one of those things which is usually based entirely on gut without anything to back it up logically. Gut is fine, but it has to have some (at least vague or tenuous) basis in logic.

I've always hated the reasoning "this fight is not TvT." It isn't scummy per se, but I don't think that it is logically possible to justify the position that a fight between two players is not TvT without explicitly scumreading one or both players. Not to say that ICE hasn't - but think about it this way. The fight between matt and chk consists of two sets of interactions - matt's actions towards chk, and chk's towards matt. If matt is town, then his interactions towards chk are going to be the same whether chk is town or scum - thus, it is impossible to distinguish between mattTown-chkTown and mattTown-chkScum based only on their interactions. Likewise, it is impossible to distinguish between mattTown-chkTown and mattScum-chkTown. Ergo, the only situation that can be distinguished from TvT solely based on their interactions is SvS - that is to say that their interactions as a whole cannot be used as a tell that would rule out TvT. It would be a legitimate argument to say "matt's actions towards chkflip look like scum -> town to me" or "chk's actions towards matt look like scum -> town to me", but to say "this fight doesn't look like TvT to me" without specifying how exactly it isn't TvT is just bullshit. Townies do it, which is sad, but it's a stupid argument - it's one of those things which is usually based entirely on gut without anything to back it up logically. Gut is fine, but it has to have some (at least vague or tenuous) basis in logic.
